reviewText: I saw this years ago and was as amazed then as a I am now. What a great, inventive plot. I only wish this movie would get the re-mastering it deserves! All of the performances except, well, for the son ... are incredibly good. It's astonishing the garbage people give 5 stars to on Amazon and I am amazed this doesn't have a much higher rating. Very nuanced performances by the leads and a great, tragic ending.

I got this because I waned to see Elena Verdugo again. ( she played the gypsy girl in House of Frankenstein, 1944) But she only has a small part as the sons' wife. This was a fair film noir that was ruined by extremely poor picture and sound. Thus not recommended.
I was very surprised at how much I enjoyed this movie. It is a true film noir. Picture is not crisp, but the sound is good.
